info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 12:05PM EDT by NWS Northern Indiana
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Michigan...
Elkhart River at Goshen affecting Elkhart and Noble Counties.
Saint Joseph River Michigan at South Bend affecting St. Joseph, Elkhart and Berrien Counties.
North Branch Elkhart River at Cosperville affecting Noble County.
For the Elkhart River...including Goshen, Cosperville...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Saint Joseph River Michigan at South Bend.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding is confined to mostly park land and golf courses. Leeper Park and Petro golf courses begin to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EDT Friday the stage was 5.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 5.9 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes.
The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 615 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

area.areaDesc: Elkhart, IN; St. Joseph, IN; Berrien, MI
